website_summaries.verdict: If the 20 ml size will fit your needs, this is the lowest-priced Feliway option that serves a variety of purposes.
pros: Offers Feliway's calming and behavior-altering properties in a smaller but affordable spray
Can be used at home, for travel, and for stress-inducing situations such as vet visits
The best choice if you are watching your budget and don't need to use it often
cons: Similar to other Feliway methods in that it doesn't produce results for all cats
Not the best pick if you plan to use it frequently

website_summaries.verdict: Although some cats won't be phased by it, Feliway has generated a base of loyal cat owners who swear by it's feline calming effects.
pros: A popular product containing feline pheromones known to reduce symptoms of feline anxiety in most cats, including fear, aggression, scratching, and marking
Handy spray bottle applicator is convenient for cats that travel, such as trips to the vet
cons: Won't work for all cats, and some seemed hesitant to go near areas where the product was sprayed

customer_reviews.title: Works well for long trips
customer_reviews.text: I just moved 3 adult cats from California to Alabama, and this product was a sanity-saver for all of us! Each morning when I loaded their crates into the car I sprayed 2 or 3 pumps onto each crate pad. I know it works, because I forgot to spray the crate pads on the 4th day of the drive, and I heard a lot of complaining. At the next rest stop I sprayed the crate pads, and everybody settled down for a nap. I definitely recommend this product for long trips, and for the first few days in a new environment.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi Gridley

customer_reviews.title: Adopted an adult homeless cat and it helped immensely
customer_reviews.text: Me & my wife recently adopted a cat from the street and we had concerns about the house training issues that might arise, but nonetheless we brought the cat home. Kitty tried to escape for the first few days but we left him alone and kept spraying feliway around the house. After 2 weeks our cat adapted and became comfortable with our presence and the new environment. Now we have a lovely companion to greet us when we come home and to pet when we feel like.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmud Jami Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Caution please read.
customer_reviews.text: It's dangerous. My cat ran right in front of me when i sprayed it. I didn't know it was highly toxic directly on them or I would not have purchased it. You must put your cat in another room while spraying. My cats eye won't open and he seems lethargic. I might have to take him to the hospital. Update, he seems fine today. I tried to return the spray but it's not returnable says Amazon because its hazardous materials.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Camron

customer_reviews.title: Please know that this is a very small travel size ...
customer_reviews.text: Please know that this is a very small travel size. Also, the packaging instructions inside the sealed box are for a different product: the diffuser plug-in and refill. The product is the 20ml spray. Tried this out anyway, and it did not help our cat. (He was still anxious enough on the trip home from the vet that he peed inside his crate that we used the feliway spray.
customer_reviews.author: sun2

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure it worked
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by the vet for my cats plane ride. Overall, my cat didn't meow at all on a full day trip (2 plane rides, 1 layover). No one knew I had her with me. Typically, my cat meows nonstop in her carrier. This travel one is worth a try. During a layover, I let her roam free in the family bathroom and reapplied it in the bag, as I think it wears off every 4 hours. I had a puppy pad in the bag for accidents and I sprayed this directly on that. Good luck! Traveling with pets is stressful!
customer_reviews.author: A SaramaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best calming spray for kitties ever
customer_reviews.text: Buy this for your kitty. Spray the pet carrier before placing your cat inside. One squirt is enough. Also spray your shirt just before you pick up your cat. Our vet used it to calm my screaming little kitty on her first veterinary visit; it was amazing -- she calmed down, stopped panting, and no longer had a terrified look on her sweet face. We ordered this small size immediately after getting home to take cat #2 to the vet the following week. It worked perfectly to ensure that our 19-pound male was happy and serene. Well, maybe not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Devoted to Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have on feral rescue cat now 7 years old and still doesn't trust people. When I have family visiting or go away overnight, I have them spray this on there clothes. It really seems to help. Before using this (or if not using this) our cat will hide for hours or days if we have visitors or she needs a pet sitter.
customer_reviews.author: SandiMacD

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have traveled with my two precious kitty sisters many times all the while listening to the deep throated “I am going to die if you don’t let me out” meow. BUT THIS WORKS!!!! I moved from Texas to Florida and sprayed their travel cages down with it and they slept al ost the whole way. I will never travel with them without this spray. My girls are 15 years old.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mcgowin

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I recently brought a new kitten home and he seemed very skittish. I'd tried the plug in diffusers in the past but noticed they all seemed to get very hot and I was concerned about leaving them plugged in, so I thought I'd give this a try. I sprayed it on all the cats' beds and blankets. It didn't seem to have any effect on the kitten or the other 2 adults cats in the house. For the price and how much I got, I can honestly say I wouldn't be willing to try it again. Luckily all the cats are getting along on their own now.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Miracle!
customer_reviews.text: Luna, my medium haired calico, does not appreciate car rides. She shoves her tiny face into the corner of the carrier and meows up a storm. We've been practicing getting over that. I'm about to make a big move across the country and she's coming with. So plenty of car rides for the little one in the hopes of getting her used to the idea. Feliway made this horrified girl calm, quiet, and. Eventually looking out the frickin window. This stuff works wonders for me. I hope it does for you too!
customer_reviews.author: Riversnakeeatscupcake

customer_reviews.title: Helped reduce stress on a cross country trip
customer_reviews.text: I had had the diffuser in my home, and we were moving cross country from WA to VA so I decided to get the spray. We tested out on a vet trip and the kitties seemed to be more calm than usual. Same on the road, it seemed to help them keep their calm better! We just sprayed some in the carrier 15 or so minutes before it was time to put them in, and also in the back seat where they roamed around. I don't think it worked quite as well as the diffuser, but that's bound to happen since it's not a constant like the diffuser is. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: RainbowEyes

customer_reviews.title: This is a must for long travels
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! I went to my vet who recommended this for my cross country road trip I had to do. This is a spray that relaxes the cat but does take about 15 minuets to kick in. How I know it works: on the 3rd day of my trip I forgot to spray their carrier and they wouldn’t stop crying so I had to grab a blanket and spray it and stick it outside their carrier so it can smelled. After an hour they were sleep again for the whole day which was several hours more. I recommend to spray about 20 minuets before travel but if forgot like me then a blanket will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Iservedaily

customer_reviews.title: Helped prevent the cat going in spot, moved another, cat urine smell less in carpet but still there.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has stopped peeing in the area but it does have a bit of an odd smell and I had to apply a few times. I did not buy the diffuser. after applying my cat moved to a new area to start peeing, so had to apply there as well. Overall working well but doesn’t necessarily prevent the cat from going near that area and it wouldn’t surprise me if he eventually went there again. The area still has a cat urine scent to it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mckenna

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for nervous cats and worried owners
customer_reviews.text: My cat is skittish on the best days and terrified of everything on bad ones. I’m doing a lot of traveling with him this month and there are very few things he hates more than being confined in a carrier. The spray does a surprisingly good job of keeping him calm in noisy cars, hopefully the same will be true of a plane. One thing is that the spray has a strong, sharp smell that may irritate your nose. So if that’s going to bother you put it somewhere away from you for those fifteen minutes while it settles
customer_reviews.author: Melody Watson

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This did not work at all. Plus, BUYER BEWARE-PRODUCT NOT RETURNABLE. I was looking forward to trying it based on reviews. I bought just the spray. The plug-in had a ton of fire/safety hazards. The spray was such a tiny bottle for the price and the instructions were not clear as they were generalized and meant for any Feliway product. The directions said spray 10-12 sprays and let dry. It was so strong even after drying and my cat didn’t want anything to do with the area. Which is missing the point because I’m trying to get my cat more comfortable, not completely deter her from the treated area. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my cats
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work. My cats still urinate all over the place. I was very disappointed because this product came highly recommended by my fellow cat person. I was really hoping this spray would take the "hate" part out of my love-hate relationship that I have with my cats. It didn't. I'll just have to stick with my daily cleaning and deodorizing method. Good thing I have leather couches and tile floors...
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Goes

customer_reviews.title: Essential Oil For Cats?
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know if this spray works. I got the diffuser as well and I really believe it's one of those things that coincidentally works better with "time"... if you catch my drift. Most cats take 2-3 weeks to get comfortable and it's ironic that Feliway products have the same efficiency range. I am torn because is this working-ish or is it just essential oil (snake oil) for cats?
customer_reviews.author: Steve & Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Made 20 hours of car travel easy
customer_reviews.text: I travelled 20 hours by car with 3 cats and 2 dogs. There was a hotel stay that night too. One of my cats usually screams bloody murder in the car/crate, but I am a shelter animal behaviorist so I knew this can help. I sprayed it in their crate before we left, 5 hours later I sprayed a hand towel and pit it in the crate, and again at the hotel. No meowing, no undue fearfulness, just 3 relaxed cats who explored the hotel room curiously and chilled. Our two dogs got Adaptil collars and they did fine, too, but they are always good in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow

customer_reviews.title: Will it work for YOUR cat?
customer_reviews.text: Feliway might work for some cats but it did not when I recently moved an eight year old adult cat from Pensacola Fl to Texas. Her reaction was wheezing and a runny nose. During our lay over she was most grateful to be out of the carrier and resisted re entry. Was willing to try but the end result was another donation to the local no kill shelter. The two star rating is based on other reviews and there perception of the product. The one stars rating are based upon how it impacted my cat.
customer_reviews.author: arsnelp

customer_reviews.title: No More Cat Siren!
customer_reviews.text: Drove From Illinois To North Carolina. My Cat Normally Starts Yowling After The Car Engine Starts, Ramping Up To A Full Siren-like State After About A Block Or So. Needless To Say, I Was Apprehensive About This Cross-Country Trek. After Researching, I Used This Feliway As Recommended (Sprayed Carrier & Towel Covering Carrier 15 Minutes Before Trip... I Repeated On Towel Covering Carrier About 7 Hours Into The 15-Hour Trip) & Also Dosed My 12lb. Potential Terror With Bach Flower Remedy ( Together... She Wasn't DOPED, But Just Chillaxed The Entire Trip. I Would HIGHLY Recommend These Two Together For Any Cat Owner. (I Used The Bach Flowers For My Border Collie As Well... No Barfing/Drooling/Freaking Out.) Must-Have For Travel.
customer_reviews.author: Susheila

customer_reviews.title: Feli-away spray
customer_reviews.text: More like Feli-away. The spray repels my cat from where I spray, and one time she even tried to mark the rug after I sprayed heavily around the area hoping she’d feel more comfortable in the living room!! I think she sees me spraying and perceives that I’m marking my territory, maybe I should try the diffuser instead.. That being said when I use it strategically under the bed it seems to help my shy new cat to come out of her hiding spot to join the world. Maybe it’s helped her adjust a little faster, I’m not sure but maybe still worth a shot..!
customer_reviews.author: Ellz

customer_reviews.title: I think it works?
customer_reviews.text: I am going to give this product an average review. I think it works a little bit but I cannot be too sure since I also give my cat Gabapentin to go to the vet. The gabapentin is meant to make her less anxious. I spray this on her carrier before we go to the vet. She seems a little more relaxed, but she still fights. I like how this is travel sized so I can bring it with me when we fly in a few days. It is a smaller size so it is TSA approved. There really isnt much to lose by trying out the product. It either works or it doesnt for your cat.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannel M.

customer_reviews.title: Vet demonstrated it to me and I was sold
customer_reviews.text: I struggle to believe these products work until I saw it for myself. I first was introduced in the vets office when I had to take in my skittish cat. He's so skittish that most of my friends and family have never seen him in person. A couple squirts of this on a towel and draped over his cat carrier and five minutes later he was straight out and purring and loving all over the vet. My first blood free vet visit with him!
customer_reviews.author: Rafe

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Feliway. My happy kitty is back!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty has been so upset lately, due to the addition of a dozen baby chicks in the house until it's warm enough outside for them, and a new cat living in the garage. I received this yesterday and used it for the first time today. Oh my goodness, my happy, relaxed kitty is back! I sprayed it in two of her favorite spots and within seconds, she relaxed and stopped pacing and meowing. It's been beautiful! I was very skeptical about this product, but now I could be a spokesperson! I'm impressed. Thanks Feliway.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy-Owen

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I sprayed a little on a towel for my cat when grooming him with a brush and some no rinse shampoo and conditioner (he's a Norwegian Forrest Cat). He was so loving during the process and kept rubbing his head on me and let me brush his coat. He's usually not a fan of getting groomed and I usually have to chase him around to get all of his coat. With this, he was pretty relaxed. I also spray it when I'm gone, either at work or just out, because he gets a little anxious sometimes. I highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby S.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My kittens freaked out the first time I put them in their carrier and took them for their shots. I ordered this with the hopes that it would be easier for them next time. And it was! Practically no howling and crying. It was so much less stressful for us all. Hopefully it will work again next week for the neutering appointment! 😉
customer_reviews.author: luckytwin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for our cats
customer_reviews.text: I have now used the whole bottle of this and never noticed a change it our cat's temperaments. I purchased this after taking one of our cats to the vet where they practiced using the aerosol version of this to spray on the towel they would lay on the table to examine the cat. It seemed to really work at the vet, but in this form it didn't. I am not sure if there is a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Ms d of 5

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in preparation for a move across the country, to help keep my cat calm. I tried it out by spraying it on a piece of fabric the she liked to lay on. After spraying it, she would have NOTHING to do with the blanket. Not worth the money, at least for my cat. I did purchase Nature's Miracle calming spray, which did work for her, if anyone is looking for another product.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat usually hates the car ride to the vet and cries the whole 45 minute ride there. I used the spray as directed and applied it to the carrier about half an hour before I placed my cat in it for the journey. The spray really helped to calm him down and although he meowed the first 5 minutes or so he calmed down quickly and remained relaxed for the ride. When we were finished at the vet he willingly (unheard of!) climbed back into the crate and he actually slept on the way home. This stuff worked awesome!
customer_reviews.author: LWA

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my cat at all
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for traveling with my cat and she actually hates it. Everything that I sprayed with that she won't go near now...and I sprayed inside her carrier and followed the product's instructions, after I put her inside she was freaking out. Maybe it all depends on your cat...
customer_reviews.author: Paula Velez

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Car Rides
customer_reviews.text: Use this for road trips with my cat. Calms her down immediately without her looking or feeling drugged. Have been buying for years.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Santello

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like it worked good for car travel
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to work. Before on shorter hour long car rides to visit family one cried the whole time and one got sick every time. This last trip was a 4 hour drive and the one that cries was much quieter and the one that gets sick did not. So it seemed to work pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: not mark twain

customer_reviews.title: Calm Senior kitty
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well this worked for a vet visit. My 13 yo cat usually cries the whole way there and then hisses and acts really threatened there. It was a quiet car ride there and the vet tech said he was really calm and fine until they had to draw blood and give shots (understandable). He was upset when brought back to the car but quickly calmed down with me once alone and was quiet the car ride back! I would recommend to get the larger bottle... this will go very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: From skittish to lap cat in 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: This flat out works!!! I adopted a rescue cat a week ago and she has hidden from me 24/7. So spooked she went days without eating or moving from her hiding spot! I sprayed one spray on my hand and once she smelled it she won’t leave me alone!!!!! Let me pick her up, pet her, and she’s following me around like a puppy would. She’s meowing so loud it’s like she’s in heat although she’s “fixed.” Two days later, haven’t sprayed anything but she still is comfortable and playful. Even asks for belly rubs. I honestly can’t believe this is the same cat. Thank you so much!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne H

customer_reviews.title: Spray pump doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I can’t tell you how effective the product is due to pump performance failure. Under COVID-19 you could not take your pets to the vet or travel around the state so I didn’t use the spray. Now that we are open again and time to go to the vet I tried using it and product failure. It is beyond the return window so not much I can do about it. Maybe buyer be pare if you are experiencing stay at home orders in your area. Keep safe
customer_reviews.author: ramyx123

customer_reviews.title: relaxes
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my 5 yo cat in her carrier to relax her while traveling to the vet. It seemed to work as she normally would cry in the car, and seemed to be relaxed in her carrier. I also spray on a towel and wipe down the other cat, to avoid the fighting when the one returning from the vet gets home. He tends to hiss at her b/c of her 'smell'. Doesn't really work on the other cat, he still hissed and was angry. Four star b/c the bottle is super tiny. I'll keep using it to see if it's the spray that is relaxing my cat or not.
customer_reviews.author: GSD

customer_reviews.title: Amazon informed me this contains hazardous chemicals.
customer_reviews.text: I used this spray, but did not calm down my cat at all. I tried to return it, but could not. I chatted with Amazon Customer service and I was advised the reason this item cannot be returned is that it contains "hazardous material". If I had known it has hazardous material in it I would had not ordered it in the first place. I don't think anyone would want to expose a cat to hazardous stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats hated the smell of this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my matted Main Coon who has always been kinda mean and gets aggressive easily. I needed to groom his mats out but hes afraid of the grooming clippers. I sprayed this down on a towel and put the towel next to wear he was laying down..he took one whiff of it and immediately got up and walked away from it. My other nice cat doesn't like this either. Idk what gives? I'm going to try mellowing them out with catnip treats or hemp oil instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kriss

customer_reviews.title: and I think that it did work pretty well! The cats were quieter than usual and ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this while flying our cats cross country with us, and I think that it did work pretty well! The cats were quieter than usual and even seemed to calm down a little on the airplane (takeoff excluded though, but that can be scary for anybody). Happy to report we are all safely and happily moved, and we are glad to have used the Feliway in the endeavor!
customer_reviews.author: Mint worm53

customer_reviews.title: Verdict is still out
customer_reviews.text: Have only used a few days to help my older cat adjust to new kittens in the house. She does seem calmer, although she might just be adjusting on her own. It took a little longer than normal for delivery and I don't see much difference since we tried it. The older cat was already warming up to the kittens before we used it. Also, please note this is a travel size, not the regular size .
customer_reviews.author: koffee247

customer_reviews.title: no idea if it does anything
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended for trapping feral cats to take to a spay/neuter clinic. I have no idea if it does anything, but what I do know is that even after being released post-neuter, the cats returned and would sniff intently at this blanket that we left outside to air out. Be careful where and how you spray it. It somewhat aggravated my asthma while aerosols were still in the air.
customer_reviews.author: allied kittens

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Defective item doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item once before and it was an entirely different spray bottle, and it worked perfectly. It helped calm my cats when we would take them to the vet. The bottle I received in my most recent purchase was a plastic bottle with a defective sprayer that does not work at all. There were quite a few negative reviews about the product being ineffective as well as a couple about the sprayer not working. I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Zero effect
customer_reviews.text: I tried this spray out hoping to calm the aggression of my older cat towards our kittens. I've given it several days spraying both their kennel/play pen, as well as scratching posts and cat tree. Anywhere they visited often. ZERO IMPROVEMENT in behaviour. My older cat is just as temperamental as before. These products generally don't work at all, and this is the same waste of money sadly.
customer_reviews.author: L. G.

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: A huge shout out! My cat hates to travel. A 10 minute ride to the vet is traumatic. I had to take him on a recent vacay and bought this product for the long trip. It worked like magic!! Cirrus was calm and happy in his carrier the entire time. No wailing. Just one happy kitty! My husband asks if they sell this for wives. Hahaha!
customer_reviews.author: Charla Bansley

customer_reviews.title: This was ok
customer_reviews.text: This product was ok. I ended up spraying it on places that my cat was peeing on after we moved. It worked for some spots but not for others. She stopped peeing on some spots but others no matter how much times I sprayed she still went back to that spot. I did see a difference in her behavior in general though. She’s starting to get more used to the place with me using the spray.
customer_reviews.author: Anzhelika Varvalyuk

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for my cats
customer_reviews.text: My veterinarian recommended this product for my cats as they both freak out when they have to go to the vet. I followed the instructions - spray inside the carrier fifteen minutes prior to placing them in - and it's never really calmed them down. They both panic at the same levels that they did before using the product. Every cat is different, of course, so it may work for yours.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: Works our furkids!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Mom, as she has inherited Grandpa’s cats. They’re adjusting well to their new environment -however even after several months, his male cat seemed to have anxiety (a condition he had before the transition). This works for our furkids, so I thought I would get some for my Mom to try. I’m giving a 3-star rating... when the bottle arrived, it looked like 1/3 of it was already used.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy B

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that works
customer_reviews.text: Our cat started spraying when we had a baby and we tried almost everything. Just when we started looking for a new home for her, a neighbor recommended feliway. This product is great, and I felt good about having it in the house with my newborn. Anytime we have a big change (traveling, visitors, another baby) we bust this out. We have the spray and the plug in dispenser. We plug it in next to her favorite lounge spots. We notice a change in her demeanor almost instantly. It's a miracle!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Customer

customer_reviews.title: Calms and soothes cat in about 10-15 min.
customer_reviews.text: Those questions are not pertinent to this product. It is for calming cats. And it seems to do that but not instantly and you cant spray it within site of the cat or they run as they dont like sprays.
customer_reviews.author: Catlover

customer_reviews.title: Cat Stayed Away From What I Sprayed On
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this product and really wished it would work, but it just didn't work for my cat. Thankfully other reviews shared that they sprayed on their cat's safe space, and then their cats refused to sit there. I sprayed this on a foam pad my cat would sit next to me on at my desk, and now she refuses to even step on the pad. Luckily I can replace this pad, but sadly enough, I won't be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: works on my brood gotta try it
customer_reviews.text: oh wow! amazing stuff. Works on towels in vicinity of cats. They sniff the air and within 2 minutes tops got hunkered down and silent. Just chillin I think. No more outbursts and they met my eyes with the sleepy nod blink. Amazing. Try it.
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner Jay

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great.
customer_reviews.text: I found myself moving out of state with a cranky old cat. At first she was a little fussy, but after a few minutes she was fast asleep. After a few hours she started to make a little more noise, so I gave her carrier and the truck's cab another spray and she was good for the rest of the trip. I also found spraying it around our new home helped her adjust. Absolutely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. One of my indoor kitties has been acting odd and suspected she is stressed for some reason. I occasionally spray just a little near catbox and a couple of her favorite spots and she is a totally different cat. Relaxed, affectionate, content. So happy she feels better!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: May be fake
customer_reviews.text: Not sure this works. Used it for my cats so they wouldn’t freak out cause of the new cat we got and when we go to vet visits I spray it on the blanket in their carrier but they still freak out. I thought it was supposed to keep them calm and happy but my cats doesn’t even seem to like the smell... this may be a fake.
customer_reviews.author: Blueberry

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, this doesn’t pass my sniff test
customer_reviews.text: I’m really not convinced this actually works. I have a gang of neighborhood hoodlum cats that terrorize my little princess at night, causing her to run to the windows and tear at my blinds. Feliway does nothing for that...or traveling to the vet, or traveling period, or avoiding the back door. I’ve given up!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Kitty hates car travel.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my kitty who is not fond of car travel but we make a three hour trip to my sisters farm several times each summer. I’m not sure if this helped or not. Once at his destination he is fine but does not relax during the trip. Used along with a comfy cushion in his kennel and a thunder vest.
customer_reviews.author: Sue N

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY PLEASED
customer_reviews.text: We had house guest for several days and we have a very shy cat. I knew she would go into hiding as she does whenever someone new is in the house. I couldn't have her terrified and hiding for days. Sprayed this an hour before his arrival and she actually stayed on 1st floor for the evening. Gave it 4 stars as effects seemed to wear off over time, even after reapplying. She hid most of the time, but at least came out for meals.
customer_reviews.author: hannahbb

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders!
customer_reviews.text: 17 hour drive with a car. This worked wonders! Sprayed it on her blanket that was in her crate. She slept most of the time! When we stopped for breaks we took her out and made her drink a little so she wasn’t dehydrated, but she was sleeping the entire time. I feel like this trip definitely was the proof of this spray working.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Davis

customer_reviews.title: Number one ingredient is Ethanol
customer_reviews.text: We used it three times. Did not do what we were hoping but I say that was user error. We ended up throwing it away after a night of wondering why it smelled so bad. Our little one hated it. That's when we saw the first ingredient was ethanol. I was shocked that they would put that in a spray for animals.
customer_reviews.author: DanielleG

customer_reviews.title: Stinks and repels cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats don’t seem to like it. They sniff the area and then walk away and go somewhere else. Since I sprayed it on areas they normally like to hang out, I felt bad about making them dislike their favorite spots! It also has a distinct bad smell—don’t believe the lie that humans won’t smell anything. You won’t smell what the cats do, but you will smell a gross almost musty odor. Stinks up the whole room.
customer_reviews.author: ckc

customer_reviews.title: This product line is 100% effective!
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mother has a cat that is named Sugar. The cat's personality is anything but sweet. Especially when there is change. I used this product to help her adapt to moving from my mother's house our guest bedroom downstairs until her smaller home arrives. The cat was calm in the cat carrier, and calm and adapted so quickly to the change of locations. This was a situation that was angst ridden and this product was a Godsend. It has been a month and three days and the cat acts like she has always been happy in this house, even with our two dogs that she hates. I can highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: sh84yo

customer_reviews.title: This makes a difference!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old cat has never traveled well...cries,pukes, poops and pees in her crate since I adopted her 6 years ago. Every 5 weeks I take her to Vet for nail clips since I can't do that by myself. Before I bought this product she was getting worse and would be panting during the ride which was very stressful for her and me. SInce buying and using this Feliway Travel Spray she's been much calmer during the (20-35 minute) ride and will generally just lay down in the crate. Not 100% without incident, but MUCH, MUCH better than it was. If you have an unhappy traveling feline, I highly recommend you try this product.
customer_reviews.author: PeejDukey

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I took both my cats on a 9 hour car ride. We had driven more than 20 minutes, so I was pretty nervous. The vet suggested this spray and it worked so well. I did find that one of my cats seemed more drawn to it than the other. I use it in the car, when we get to a new place, when we get home from being gone, and before I leave them on a long trip. I didn't notice any odor and it leaves no stains.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: We were having a problem with our cat defecating outside of the litterbox on this one spot on the rug, the vet suggested to get this and spray it on the spot regularly. It did nothing. In the end, we got a different litter for his royal highness. lol.
customer_reviews.author: Nika

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother with small size
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste money on the small bottle. I have used it twice (8 pumps as directed) and it is almost gone. I also saw no effect on either my kitties. Maybe more frequently used this would work but for $14, I would have liked it to have gotten more than three uses. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: This made me sick and my kitty ran away from the places I sprayed it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this product is a conterfeit or if it is the real thing. All I know is that I got sick for 4 days after spraying it on a towel and my shirt in order to clip my kitty's nails. He ran away from the towel and would have nothing to do with me until I removed the shirt (which I had to do within minutes because it made me so sick). I was going to return it, but amazon does not allow returns on this product. The only reason I gave it one star is the system wouldn't let me publish this without giving it at least one star. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Carmona

customer_reviews.title: It calmed my two male cats instantly
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. We brought a new adopted cat into our house and they weren’t friendly with each other at first. We got our feliway in the mail and it was a miracle product. Something about it really calms them. I bought the travel size spray but will be getting another larger spray just in case. I don’t even have to use it very much now buts it’s nice to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! I sprayed it on my stairs one time and my kitty stopped shredding the carpet. Wish I knew about this stuff sooner. Downside is that this bottle is tiny and after two uses on just my stairs it’s empty. Also it smells kinda like raw chicken when you first spray it.
customer_reviews.author: Bogiefan1995

customer_reviews.title: This product didn't work for my kitties.
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving a bad review and perhaps it's not fair if this product worked for others, but for me it was a waste of money. I needed this product desparetly as I read some of the positive reviews and my fur baby needed something to help her with the anxiety of getting in the car and going to the vet. It did absolutely nothing. I tried again and again for other situations for both my kitties as I wanted it to work for when I would need it. No luck. Unfortunately it did nothing. I hope others have better luck with this product.
customer_reviews.author: sojourner2020

customer_reviews.title: 5 days, 3000 miles, calm kitty.
customer_reviews.text: Five long driving days, 3,000 miles, calm kitty. We sprayed this on her bedding every morning before leaving for the day's journey. She usually hates the cat carrier and complains. But this time, on her longest drive ever, my kitty was relaxed, calm, even gave me blinky love eyes. Truthfully I was prepared for this to not work at all but on a drive this long I wanted to at least try. Very glad I did! We did test this in the days leading up to the move by spraying it near her stuff, to be sure it didnt have an unwanted effect. Definitely give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: S. Maggie May

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Failure
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work at all. My cat continues to bully my other cat off the bed and out of the bathroom. I sprayed this over the scratching posts, the sleeping spaces, all significant places. My vet recommended this. So disappointed. This tiny bottle is NOT worth the price as it is to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Calming and upset cat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cat who was very upset by a very long move to a new home I find that it does make a difference along with wearing the cat collar the calming collar. Find the price a little bit high but other than that the product is a good use and has refills
customer_reviews.author: Melea

customer_reviews.title: No effect
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this on a rug twice a day and by my bedroom door before I went to sleep in hopes that my cat would stop scratchings the rug and howling when I decide to close my door at night. It's been maybe 2-3 weeks and I've use the whole bottle, but seen no chance in behavior except I think she rubs her face on furniture more often now. I can't return for a refund it because it's flammable. Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t do a thing for my cat
customer_reviews.text: I imagine this depends on your cat. Mine sniffed, tried to bury it and walked away. In fact, he’d leave the room if I sprayed it. So he clearly didn’t like it. Too bad. He really needs something to calm him down and stop the over-grooming problem. I was hoping this would help.
customer_reviews.author: Sprite

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Spray!!!
customer_reviews.text: My vet highly recommended this product to help my cat get into her cage easier. She is a very difficult cat & i have to chase her down then wrap her in a towel to drop her in the cage. She then normally has horrible diarrhea in the cage from stress. I purchased this product sprayed the towel then wrapped her in it & put her in the cage. She had the calmest car ride to the vet & was great when she got there. She seemed so much more at ease & no accident in the cage!!!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S.

customer_reviews.title: 4 cats travel quietly on 650 mile trip
customer_reviews.text: Moved my four cats on a 650 mile trip and I was a happy driver and cats were happy passengers. Sprayed crates in back of SUV at start of trip and two more times 99 % peace and quiet for the trip. Highly recommend this product. Was a little skeptical at first. Now a firm believer. The cats slept almost the entire trip. Awesome stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Gamechanger!
customer_reviews.text: I was so skeptical of this product working as advertised but gearing up to move 2 hours away with two anxious kitties who hate car trips I decided to give this a try. To my surprise it worked like a dream! I sprayed in their cat carriers & in the car 10 minutes ahead of time and they both were so relaxed the entire trip! No yowling or scratching to get out as usual. One actually napped! I also sprayed around the new apartment before we let them loose and the usual exploration anxiety was very minimal. I would highly recommend to anyone who has a travelphobic kitty!
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Was mine used already?
customer_reviews.text: To be clear, I have purchased this product before, and gave my old one to my daughter and it is still in use. I just received this product and it is empty after 15 sprays... not sure if mine was used already, very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Susan S

customer_reviews.title: Totally works
customer_reviews.text: We first used this to spray the inside of our cat's kennels when moving cross country. It absolutely worked to calm one cat and kind of worked on the other. It doesn't make your cat seem 'out of it' or anything, just chills them out. Our extremely nervous cat wasn't affected much. Once at home, if they are extremely antsy or if we're going to the vet, I'll spray a little in a high trafficked area. My only complaint is it comes in tiny bottles.
customer_reviews.author: L.D.T

customer_reviews.title: It didn't help my cat
customer_reviews.text: Used this to help keep my cat calm on a long car ride while moving long distance. Whenever I sprayed it, my cat would become very irretated. So I had to forgo using the spray and tough it out the whole drive. I wouldn't buy it again even though the price is very reasonable compared to the store prices.
customer_reviews.author: roseber57

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my cats
customer_reviews.text: Drove from Washington State to South Carolina. Scared the crap out of me the first couple of times I used it the cats were so Quiet and chill I thought they were dead!! But after like 3 hours they were back to there normal talkative selves. So instead of the recommended amount I used lesss the last couple of times. But it worked I Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: IT works!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats and this product has helped with one of my A#$ cat (i love him) to stop spraying! ugh. And yes, he is fixed. SO I do spray this multiple times a day (3-4) plus I purchased an enzyme solution. I think both products have helped with getting rid and keeping clean scent. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Really, really works !
customer_reviews.text: This product really works!! Last time, before Feliway, the 3 hr car trip to see the Vet Specialist with Homer, my big fluff boy, was a non-stop howling, wining, crying nightmare. This time, I sprayed a shot of Feliway in each corner of the carrier and low and behold, Homer did not utter even a meow the entire trip AND back. This stuff is great!
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to not even leave his cat condo and now he sleeps with me every night. Since I bought this he’s become more adventurous and cuddly and I’m so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Baechtel

customer_reviews.title: It worked beyond my expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to transport 2 cats in a carrier out of state and there was very little signs of distress from the cats during the trip. I few meows when I first set out. The trip lasted 8 hours due to a malfunction on my driving directions. It should have taken only 5 hours. On the trip back home I sprayed carriers as directed and we were back home in 5 hours and 30 minutes . Only a few meows half way through the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: This did nothing for our cat, unfortunately. We adopted a new cat and the entire reason was to have a playmate for our existing cat. Well the new cat, she hates him. She is super loving and sweet to us, but wants to attack and chase him every time they are together. We tried the spray and the collar, no change in her. It's very heartbreaking to keep them separate, I wish this was the answer. But sadly, not.
customer_reviews.author: volvomom

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work
customer_reviews.text: This spray had no effect on my 2 year old North American Chimera Tortoiseshell cat. I had a road trip planned and she was coming with me. I tested the spray in several places around the house and my vehicle. She did not respond to it at all. She was very upset in the car, even after several "training drives" to various locations. I do not recommend this product. I am now taking her on that move, writing from my hotel room. An 8 hour drive and she was NOT calm the entire time. She would have been better described as uncalm.
customer_reviews.author: Glue

customer_reviews.title: Calm my cat
customer_reviews.text: This worked so well for calming my cat down before putting her in the carrier to visit the vet. Sprayed it on a towel. Wrapped her with the towel & held her. Also sprayed the inside of the carrier. Calm & mellow on the way to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: CraftAddict

customer_reviews.title: Stressed out cat (when going to the vet) calms down right away
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. I spray it on a towel I place in his carrier when going to vet and he calms down and stops shaking so much. He lets the vet do what's needed without freaking out. I also have the plug in refills in two spots in our house which keeps him much calmer than when they're not in use.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Recommended by my Vet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great investment if you have pets that are over active. My kittens get along fine and don't fight as much. This product also helped to get my kittens to the vet, by allowing us to get them into the carriers without problems!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Good for over anxious cats
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works for my neurotic, OCD cat, Amazon delivery driver is horrible, never follows delivery instructions 😡
customer_reviews.author: messy jessy

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for stopping a cat from urinating in a bed
customer_reviews.text: I cant attest to the calming aspects for traveling but I got this to try to stop my kitty from peeing on my daughters bed and sadly it didn’t help at all. I sprayed 3 sprays on her sheets where she has done her business before and within 15 minutes she went and peed on the same spot again. We’ve ruled out bladder or other health problems from the vet, I’m just trying to think of anything else to try and I was hoping this product would make a difference. Sadly it did not :(
customer_reviews.author: DisneyMom

customer_reviews.title: Seems to Work!
customer_reviews.text: Well, we travel in our RV with our cat and those long road trips with her in the carrier, in the car, are long, for her and for us. She seems quite anxious and meows a lot. So, we got this product and sprayed her blanket in her carrier 20 minutes before we left. OMG...not a peep!! However, I think she was so relaxed that her bladder let loose every time we used it (three times total).
customer_reviews.author: Allison Cornett

customer_reviews.title: No effect
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not respond to this product. I gave it to my daughter to use with her two cats; they don't respond. Waste of money I would say.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mackey

customer_reviews.title: feliway travel spray
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! My cat is very nervous riding in the car. I practiced for several days for 2 to 3 minute rides and adjusted the sprays each day. I started with 1 spray in the carrier and one in the car. I ended up doing 3 sprays in the car and 4 sprays in the carrier and my Willow had the best car ride. I didn't put her in the carrier for about 45 to 60 minutes after spraying the inside and the same for the car. I did however leave the car windows open a bit to ventilate the car after spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cattanach

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money - Good for travel but use diffuser at home
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have paid attention to the amount of spray that comes in this TINY bottle. I should have spent the extra 5 or 6 bucks and got the bigger bottle. The instructions described on amazon do not match instructions on box. Box says to spray it in desired areas 2 to 3 times per day. Spray lasts 4 to 5 hours. I had a large hallway area to spray and used almost 30% of the spray in one use. Maybe I am doing something wrong. I wish I spent the money on the diffuser instead but I was worried about fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Marilynn

customer_reviews.title: good for protecting furniture
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased a new couch and had issues with one of our cats wanting to scratch/claw it. Adding extra scratching boards in the room helped, but we noticed a big difference after spraying it with this stuff. We have to spray it every few days, which is why I’m giving this four stars as it’s not cheap, but it has definitely helped!
customer_reviews.author: Kael

customer_reviews.title: Consult your vet. Does not work on all cats
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended we try this before treating our cat with medications. We used this in combination with the plug in calming oil and did not notice ANY difference in our elderly cat's aggressiveness or caterwauling behaviors.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne P.

customer_reviews.title: Smelled & increased peeing
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this smell very strongly (despite being advertised as odorless), but also my cat peed directly on the bed where I sprayed it within 5 minutes. As you can imagine, this is the kind of behavior we’re trying to avoid. A total waste of money for what I expected it to do.
customer_reviews.author: HSW

customer_reviews.title: Felway products work
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to declaw my cats, but the constant destruction of furniture and carpeting was too expensive. My vet suggested trying Felway on scatching pads. No more destruction without harming Austin and Emmy.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L

product_meta.title: Feliway Cat Calming Pheromone Spray (20 ml), #1 Vet Recommended Solution, Reduce Anxiety for Vet Visits, Travel, Loud Noises and More
product_meta.description: Size:20 mLIs your cat peeing outside the litter box, scratching your furniture and carpet, or hiding on a regular basis? These behaviors may be caused by fear or anxiety. FELIWAY products are a vet recommended, drug free, and clinically proven to help alleviate many of the unwanted behaviors cat owners deal with. FELIWAY Spray provides “happy messages” by mimicking the natural feline reassuring messages (pheromones) to make cats feel calm and comfortable at home. This product has been found to reduce scratching, spraying, and hiding for 90% of cats, and many owners see results within 7 days. Cats are also very sensitive to change, so if you anticipate changes in the home (moving, renovation, recorating, new pets, new family members, etcs.), FELIWAY is very effective in helping your cats remain calm, and adapt to the changes without unwanted behaviors. If you are having issues with spraying (peeing), after cleaning urine-affected areas, spray FELIWAY directly onto the urine marks, as well as onto other prominent objects including furniture, drapes, window frames and doorways. This helps your cat to feel calm, and reduces unwanted behaviors caused by anxiety (like peeing outside the litterbox). This will also help them to stop scratching and hiding as well. Feliway Spray is completley safe for both humans, and your cat - it is odorless and colorless. Spray away the fear, and feel calmer today! Each bottle contains up to 50 sprays.
feature_bullets: Vet recommended: Feliway is the #1 vet recommended solution to help cats adjust to challenging situations and curb stress related unwanted behaviors
Reduces scratching and urine spraying: Clinically proven to reduce scratching and urine spraying in 9/10 cats. Results may be seen as early as 7 days
Effective for 90% of cats: Great for on the go use, or spot treatment at home - you can spray calming pheromones directly onto objects, your car, or cat carrier
Ease the stress of a new environment, loud noises (thunder, fireworks, etc), travel, vet visits, and more
Drug free solution: Our spray mimics natural pheromones, which helps to put cats at ease in a natural and safe way

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
